members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This class allows us to render the design time mode with custom HTML
The reason for implementing this class is to allow a default tabstrip to be shown at design-time, when no tabs are present in the html
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Adds HTML attributes and styles that need to be rendered to the specified System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.
The attributes handled by this method include: display, label id, tabid, and class (css)
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
There are 2 parts to render for each tab. The Label and the panel with the contents. The contents are rendered through the normal rendering methods, however, an explicit call is made to render the label since we may render the label but not the contents
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This property allows the developer to determine whether or not the controls contained within the tab are part of the postback.
The controls within a tab that is rendered on demand will need to use this property instead of the Page's IsPostback method.
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This property allows the developer to determine whether or not the controls contained within the tab are part of the callback.
The controls within a tab that is rendered on demand will possibly use this property for defaulting data.
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Access to the control containing this tab is necessary in order to pull properties pertaining to the tab. For example, css.
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Assigns how the tabs will be rendered.
All - All tabs along with the html of the controls are sent down to the client. When user changes the tab dhtml is used to display Postback - Only the selected tab and the html of the controls within it are sent to the client. When the user clicks another tab a postback occurs causing a new tab to display. Callback - Only the selected tab and the html of the controls within it are sent to the client. When the user clicks another tab a callback occurs to retrieve the html for the new tab.
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If tab is rendered through callback, this property determines what data is available to the callback handler
None - Only the minimal information to perform a callback is passed. DNNVariable - Only the variables set through the ClientAPI are posted Tab - All form data from the rendered tab's conrols is posted Form - The entire form's data is posted
[Jon Henning] 8/23/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This property determines what type of callback is used
The Simple callback short-circuits at the Page Init event while the ProcessPage will run the page through the entire page's lifecycle.
[Jon Henning] 8/9/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.IDNNTreeWriter
member.summary: IDNNTreeWriter interface declaration. All the objects which want to implement a writer class for the DNNTree should inherit from this interface.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.IDNNTreeWriter.RenderTree(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.DNNTree)
member.summary: When implemented renders the tree.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Text to display on the Tab
NotifyParentPropertyAttribute - (with the constructor argument equal to true) applied to the Text property causes the editor to serialize changes in these properties into their parent property, an instance of the Tab class.
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.ITreeNodeWriter
member.summary: ITreeNodeWriter interface declaration. All the objects which want to implement a writer class for the TreeNode should inherit from this interface.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.ITreeNodeWriter.RenderNode(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.TreeNode)
member.summary: When implemented renders an Node inside the tree.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If callbacks are supported/enabled, this javascript function will be invoked with each status change of the xmlhttp request.
The Javascript transport does not raise any events.
[Jon Henning] 4/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This property determines what type of callback is used
The Simple callback short-circuits at the Page Init event while the ProcessPage will run the page through the entire page's lifecycle.
[Jon Henning] 9/14/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This javascript function will be invoked just before persisting the data
To cancel a tab from changing return false from this function
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.IDNNMenuWriter
member.summary: IDNNMenuWriter interface declaration. All the objects which want to implement a writer class for the DNNMenu should inherit from this interface.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.IDNNMenuWriter.RenderMenu(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.DNNMenu)
member.summary: When implemented renders the Menu.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Responsible for rendering the DNNMenu and in an uplevel rendering of the Menu, sending down the xml for the child nodes in a ClientAPI variable.
[Jon Henning] 5/6/2005 Created [Jon Henning 4/6/2005 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Allows you to have a common JS function be invoked for all nodes, unless a different JS function is provided on the node level.
If the client-side function returns false, the action associated to the node selection will be canceled
[Jon Henning] 4/6/2005 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If callbacks are supported/enabled, this javascript function will be invoked with each status change of the xmlhttp request.
The Javascript transport does not raise any events.
[Jon Henning] 4/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Constructor to call when creating a Root Node
Namespace of node hierarchy DnnMenu control associated to MenuNodeCollection
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Loads node collection based off of XML string
XML String XSL FileName. Leave empty if no transform needed DNN Menu control
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Constructor to call when creating a Root Node
Namespace of node hierarchy DNNTree control associated to TreeNodeCollection
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Loads node collection based off of XML string
XML String XSL FileName. Leave empty if no transform needed DNN Tree control
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The init handler is responsible to register the dnnvariable control. We are also loading the posted values in this method
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The prerender event handler is responsible for registering the required scripts along with setting up the postback logic
[Jon Henning] 8/8/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The overridden sub is responsible for rendering our tab's labels along with the tabs content panels that either are selected, previously rendered, or are supposed to be rendered based off of TabRenderMode
[Jon Henning] 8/9/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This method is responsible for obtaining the HTML of a given tab.
The original technique used here is the same as the one found on this site. http://aspnet.4guysfromrolla.com/articles/102203-1.2.aspx
EventValidation must be disabled in order to work (.NET 2.0 specific)
[Jon Henning] 8/9/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If callbacks are supported/enabled, this javascript function will be invoked with each status change of the xmlhttp request.
The Javascript transport does not raise any events.
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This javascript function will be invoked whenever the user clicks on a tab other than the currently selected one
To cancel a tab from changing return false from this function
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Assigns how the tabs will be rendered.
All - All tabs along with the html of the controls are sent down to the client. When user changes the tab dhtml is used to display Postback - Only the selected tab and the html of the controls within it are sent to the client. When the user clicks another tab a postback occurs causing a new tab to display. Callback - Only the selected tab and the html of the controls within it are sent to the client. When the user clicks another tab a callback occurs to retrieve the html for the new tab.
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This property Exposes the tabstrip's tab collection
DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute - Setting the Content parameter specifies that a visual designer should serialize the contents of the property. In the example, the property contains Tab objects. PersistenceModeAttribute - Passing the InnerDefaultProperty parameter specifies that a visual designer should persist the property to which the attribute is applied as an inner default property. This means that a visual designer persists the property within the control's tags. The attribute can be applied to only one property, because only one property can be persisted within the control's tags. The property value is not wrapped in a special tag.
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Default properties to use for a tab's label
This is more efficient to use (less payload) than specifying the same properties on each individual tab
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Default css class name to use for a tab's container
This is more efficient to use (less payload) than specifying the same css class name on each individual tab
[Jon Henning] 8/7/2006 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This property determines what type of callback is used
The Simple callback short-circuits at the Page Init event while the ProcessPage will run the page through the entire page's lifecycle.
[Jon Henning] 8/9/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Responsible for rendering the DNNTree and in an uplevel rendering of the tree, sending down the xml for the child nodes in a ClientAPI variable.
[jbrinkman] 5/6/2004 Created [Jon Henning 4/6/2005 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Returns whether the tree will render DownLevel or not
[Jon Henning] 2/22/2005 Commented [Jon Henning] 3/9/2005 Requiring XML support on client for uplevel [Jon Henning] 11/28/2005 rendering downlevel if it is a crawler
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Allows you to have a common JS function be invoked for all nodes, unless a different JS function is provided on the node level.
If the client-side function returns false, the action associated to the node selection will be canceled
[Jon Henning] 4/6/2005 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If callbacks are supported/enabled, this javascript function will be invoked with each status change of the xmlhttp request.
The Javascript transport does not raise any events.
[Jon Henning] 4/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Returns whether the TextSuggest will render DownLevel or not
[Jon Henning] 2/22/2005 Commented [Jon Henning] 3/9/2005 Requiring XML support on client for uplevel
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This property really makes no sense for this control and should not be here, but due to concerns for backwards compatibility I am keeping.
[Jon Henning] 5/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Allows you to have a common JS function be invoked for all nodes, unless a different JS function is provided on the node level.
If the client-side function returns false, the action associated to the node selection will be canceled
[Jon Henning] 4/6/2005 Commented
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If callbacks are supported/enabled, this javascript function will be invoked with each status change of the xmlhttp request.
The Javascript transport does not raise any events.
[Jon Henning] 4/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies a delimiter to be used to allow for multiple entries to be added.
This should be a safe character that is not going to be used as an entry itself.
[Jon Henning] 2/24/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies a type of character to be used to surround/delimit the underlying value/id of the selected item
An example of the text generated with this set to Brackets would be Smith [123]
[Jon Henning] 2/24/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Maximum number of rows to display.
This is important since it will allow the client side code to determine when a new lookup is needed. As a developer you need to return MaxSuggestRows + 1 results down to the client in order for it to determine when a lookup is required.
[Jon Henning] 2/24/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This property determines what type of callback is used
The Simple callback short-circuits at the Page Init event while the ProcessPage will run the page through the entire page's lifecycle.
[Jon Henning] 9/14/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.IMenuNodeWriter
member.summary: IMenuNodeWriter interface declaration. All the objects which want to implement a writer class for the MenuNode should inherit from this interface.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.IMenuNodeWriter.RenderNode(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.MenuNode)
member.summary: When implemented renders an Node inside the Menu.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Default constructor
When using this constructor your node will not have properties that are related to the xml node hierarchy until you associate the node with the hierarchy. This is accomplished by adding it to the DNNNodeCollection or by calling Import directly
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Constructor providing the defaulting of the Text property
Text for the Node
When using this constructor your node will not have properties that are related to the xml node hierarchy until you associate the node with the hierarchy. This is accomplished by adding it to the DNNNodeCollection or by calling Import directly
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Constructor to create a Node already associated to a hierarchy
Preferred method for creating a node. Since the node wraps the XmlNode object there will be no need for an intermediate holder of the attributes, they can be directly written to the XmlNode object that belongs to the hierarchy.
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Property to access attribute collection for the node. If property is not set, the passed in default value will be returned
Attribute Name Value to return when attribute not set
Until the node is in a hierarchy, thus allowing the creation of an XmlNode, the attributes will be stored in a hashtable. Once the node is associated with a hierarchy, these attributes will be transferred to the XmlNode
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Since an XmlNode cannot exist without a document, and since the node's interface allows the creation of a node without a document, we need to expose a way for the node to be added to a document.
XmlNode to associate with the DNNNode object
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A node that is instantiated without knowledge of its parent is created "stand-alone", therefore, it does not belong to an xmldocument, until associated with a DNNNodeCollection Until this association takes place, the node will not be able to expose a property/method that requires the hierarchy. This property indicates the node's membership to a hierarchy.
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets the node's parent namespace by walking the chain up until it reaches the root. This name plus a unique identifier for the node will be unique.
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
URL to navigate to when node is selected
[Jon Henning] 12/22/2004 Created [Jon Henning] 11/14/2005 When assigning a NavigateUrl, set clickaction to navigate to maintain backwards compat
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of NodeImage objects.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NodeImageCollection class.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.#ctor(DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NodeImageCollection class containing the elements of the specified source collection.
member.param: A NodeImageCollection with which to initialize the collection.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.#ctor(DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImage[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NodeImageCollection class containing the specified array of NodeImage objects.
member.param: An array of NodeImage objects with which to initialize the collection.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.Add(DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImage)
member.summary: Add an element of the specified NodeImage to the end of the collection.
member.param: An object of type NodeImage to add to the collection.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Add an element of the specified NodeImage to the end of the collection.
member.param: An object of type NodeImage to add to the collection.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.AddRange(DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImage[])
member.summary: Copies the elements of the specified NodeImage array to the end of the collection.
member.param: An array of type NodeImage containing the objects to add to the collection.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.AddRange(DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection)
member.summary: Adds the contents of another NodeImageCollection to the end of the collection.
member.param: A NodeImageCollection containing the objects to add to the collection.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.IndexOf(DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImage)
member.summary: Gets the index in the collection of the specified NodeImageCollection, if it exists in the collection.
member.param: The NodeImageCollection to locate in the collection.
member.returns: The index in the collection of the specified object, if found; otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.Contains(DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImage)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection contains the specified NodeImageCollection.
member.param: The NodeImageCollection to search for in the collection.
member.returns: true if the collection contains the specified object; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.Insert(System.Int32,DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImage)
member.summary: Add an element of the specified NodeImage to the collection at the designated index.
member.param: An Integer to indicate the location to add the object to the collection.
An object of type NodeImage to add to the collection.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.Remove(DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImage)
member.summary: Remove the specified object of type NodeImage from the collection.
member.param: An object of type NodeImage to remove to the collection.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.CopyTo(DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImage[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the collection objects to a one-dimensional Array instance beginning at the specified index.
member.param: The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the values copied from the collection.
The index of the array at which to begin inserting.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.ToArray
member.summary: Creates a one-dimensional Array instance containing the collection items.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.TrackViewState
member.summary: (TrackViewState) Instructs the NodeImageCollection to track changes to its view state.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.SaveViewState
member.summary: (IStateManager.SaveViewState) Saves the changes of NodeImageCollection's view state to an Object.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.LoadViewState(System.Object)
member.summary: (IStateManager.LoadViewState) Loads the NodeImageCollection's previously saved view state.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Gets the NodeImageCollection at the specified index in the collection.
In VB.Net, this property is the indexer for the NodeImageCollection class.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.NodeImageCollection.IsTrackingViewState
member.summary: (IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState) Gets a value indicating whether the NodeImageCollection is tracking its view state changes.
